Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: The user gave pseudo-BPMN textual representation and a prompt to the LLM: generate 20 open-ended, thought-provoking questions that delve deeper into the rationale behind the process flows, potential improvements, risk management, decision-making, stakeholder communication, and performance measurement. They explicitly say: Do not provide any SQL queries; just list the questions.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: So output should be a list of 20 questions, each on its own line or numbered, but no SQL.

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: We should comply. No extra text. Just list questions. Ensure they are open-ended, thought-provoking, covering rationale, improvements, risk management, decision-making, stakeholder communication, performance measurement. Well produce 20 bullet points or numbered list. Probably numbered list is fine. No extra explanation. Just the questions.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Lets craft them. 1. Why is market research conducted before any component sourcing decisions, and how does it influence subsequent steps? 2. How does the choice of parallel component securing affect overall procurement risk and lead time? ... Make sure 20. Lets write.
